content:
This code defines a function `parse_csv` that takes in three arguments: an `input_file`, an `output_file`, and `parse_rules`. The function opens the `input_file` and reads the data using a CSV reader object. Then it opens the `output_file` and creates a CSV writer object.

The function then iterates through each row in the input file and extracts the desired data according to the `parse_rules` specified. It does this by calling the `apply_parse_rules` function and passing in the current row and the `parse_rules` as arguments. The `apply_parse_rules` function, in turn, applies each parse rule to the current row and returns a list of the extracted data.

Finally, the function writes the extracted data to the output file using the CSV writer object.

The code also defines an `apply_parse_rule` function that takes in a row and a parse rule and extracts the desired data from the specified column using the regular expression specified in the parse rule.

The code also includes a block of code that can be run if the script is executed directly. This block of code uses the `argparse` module to parse command-line arguments specifying the input and output files and the parse rules. It then calls the `parse_csv` function to extract data from the input file and write it to
